ygData.subject: Re: Kill Stealing
ygData.msgSnippet: I just told you how - if he is doing 250 damage a turn and the group is doing 500+ a turn - how can he???????????????/ ... From: Mr. J Daniels
ygData.messageBody:
I just told you how - if he is doing 250 damage a turn and the group is
doing 500+ a turn - how can he???????????????/


----- Original Message -----
From: Mr. J Daniels <warpig@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, August 03, 1999 4:22 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Kill Stealing


> From: "Mr. J Daniels" <warpig@...>
>
> Well most kill stealing I have encountered is from wizards that are many
> levels above my group. If a monster only has 500 hp and the wizard does
> 250 dmg there is NO way the group can do more.
>
> Mr. J Daniels
>
>
> On Tue, 3 Aug 1999, Vicki wrote:
>
> > From: "Vicki" <vicki@...>
> >
> >
> >
> > > From: "Mr. J Daniels" <warpig@...>
> > >
> > > One wiz can do enough damage to a mob that the total gropu can not
make
> > > up for. Your idea, in theory makes sense, however, it would not
> > > correct the situation.
> >
> > Wrong, usually speaking a kill stealer has to stay within the levels he
is
> > and the others who are hunting the same place. A 12th level Wiz may be
able
> > to steal kill from a 15 level Magician ALONE - BUT he cannot get off
enough
> > spells to make up for a group total nor would he have the mana to do
such a
> > thing blasting his high mana spells off.
> >
> > Our 4 person group on one round can do about 500 damage with spells not
> > counting pets and melee. No lone Wiz can compete with that unless he is
> > *very* high level above us and that is usually not the case. Usually
the
> > kill stealer wants to get off that one shot of a large damage spell so
they
> > get the kill but take no risk. Usually at that point if everyone stops
> > attacking and backs away towards the KS - and then politely say how very
> > sorry you are, and here you can have it :) makes them go away very soon
:)
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
